bibl.title: Demarco v. McKay. Memo from Petitioner Attorney
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Tacoma
In the matter of the Petition of Frank Demarco for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To Hon John P. Hoyt Judge of said Court,

Your petitioner respectfully reprients and alleges that on Thursday February March third 1887, he was amstd and taken into custody by H.F. McKay Chief of Police of the city of Tacoma W.T. and incarcerated in the city jail; that he has been confined and imprisoned in said jail given the time of his amst and now is
& since has been unlawfully restrained of dulis liberty and so confined; that he has not been charged with any crime, nor his be any effort or attempt then much your his been brought before any court, and there confronted with any charge or criminal complaint, and he is not now, nor at any time has he been held and committed & said city prison nor is the custody of said H.F. McKay by virtue of any commitment or warrant issued and jury court of a justice of the peace, or District Court of said Territory
